intro: Tripetalanthus, commonly known as the African sand mat, is a genus of flowering plants native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its succulent, mat-forming growth habit. The plants typically have small, fleshy leaves and produce clusters of tiny, greenish flowers. They are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in sandy or rocky soils. Due to their resilience and ornamental appeal, some species are cultivated as decorative plants in gardens.
